name: The Computer Room
description: You're in a large, brightly lit room. A single, uncomfortable looking metal chair sits before a huge computer console that takes up nearly the entire north wall. There's a door to the south.

look: It's covered in blinking lights, gauges, switches, keyboards, and inputs. {button}
Hint: You can perform all sorts of actions in the game. If you need more guidance you can look at this "note" that I left here that will tell you exactly what you need to do to progress.

args: You pick a random keyboard and punch in the passkey. The glass case covering a red button flips open.
You pick a keyboard and start punching keys. It doesn't work. Looks like you'll need a passkey.

TUTORIAL_PC_KEY: You pick a random keyboard and punch in the passkey. The glass case covering a red button flips open.

look: Theres a handwritten note taped to the computer console next to the button:

]The "Exit Door Clamp Control" button will seal or unseal the main exit from the tutorial facility.
To use the button, you would type "push button".

sit: You sit in the chair. It isn't very comfortable so you stand back up.

notice: There is a button labeled "Exit Door Clamp Control" with a glass case.
look: It's a round, red button. There's a label above it: "Exit Door Clamp Control".

args: The glass case around it is flipped open. You can push the button now.
There is a glass case around it sealing it in. You won't be able to push the button until it's open.
You hear mechanical whirring and then a loud clank from the south.
You can't push the button. There's a glass case sealing it in!
The glass case is flipped up, allowing access to the button.
The glass case is sealing in the button. You'll have to use a passkey on the computer to open it.

open: There's no way to physically open it. You'll have to use a passkey on the computer.
break: You smack it a good one but it doesn't break.
smash: You smack it a good one but it doesn't break.
